tables.description: Stores the performance metrics for tourism-related Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) over time. Each row represents a single data point for an indicator at a specific interval.

columns.description: The unique, primary English name for the Key Performance Indicator (KPI). Use this column to identify and filter for specific indicators.
The unique, primary Arabic name for the KPI.
The English name of the source of the data for this indicator (e.g., 'Qatar Tourism').
The Arabic name of the source of the data for this indicator.
The long-term, STRATEGIC target value for the indicator, which is planned to be achieved by the 'TargetYear'.
The year by which the long-term 'TargetValue' is expected to be achieved.
The starting value of the indicator in the 'BaseLineYear', used for long-term comparison against 'TargetValue'.
The starting year for the 'BaseLineValue'.

The English unit of measurement for the 'Actual', 'Target', 'TargetValue', and 'BaseLineValue' columns (e.g., 'bn QAR', '%', 'Million'). This unit should always be displayed with any numerical value from the row.
The Arabic unit of measurement.

A display format code that dictates how numerical values in the row should be presented. For example: '0' means display as a whole number; '0.0m' means display the value in millions with one decimal place.
The classification of the KPI. Must be one of the specified values.
The time frequency at which the indicator is measured (e.g., Quarterly, Monthly).
The specific time period for this data record. Formats are 'YYYY-Q#' for Quarterly or 'YYYY-MM' for Monthly. This should be converted to a standard date for sorting and time-based filtering.
The actual measured value ('what really happened') of the indicator for the specific 'IntervalValue'.
The short-term, OPERATIONAL target value ('what was planned') for the specific 'IntervalValue'. This should be compared with the 'Actual' value to gauge performance for that period.

tables.description: Stores denormalized details for tourism programs and their associated projects. IMPORTANT: Each row represents a single detail (a milestone, risk, or recommendation) for a project, meaning a single project can have multiple rows. Queries aggregating project-level data (like budgets) MUST first get a DISTINCT list of projects to avoid incorrect, inflated calculations.

columns.description: The English name of the parent program that contains one or more projects.
The Arabic name of the parent program.
The current status of the entire Program.
The current status of the entire Program in Arabic.
The total allocated budget for the entire Program specified in 'ProgramNameEN'.
The remaining budget for the entire Program.
The strategic objective of the Program. Values like 'Stg 1' likely refer to 'Stage 1'.
The strategic objective of the Program in Arabic.
The English name of the project. A project is part of a Program. Note that a single project name can appear in multiple rows.
The Arabic name of the project.
The current status of the Project.
The current status of the Project in Arabic.
The specific objective of the Project.
The specific objective of the Project in Arabic.
The name of the external or internal entity supporting the project.
The Arabic name of the entity supporting the project.
A detailed text update on the project's progress.
A detailed text update on the project's progress in Arabic.

A summary of the project's status at the time of the interval. This is scraped data and may contain HTML tags like '

' that might need to be cleaned before display.
A summary of the project's status in Arabic, may also contain HTML tags.
The date when the assessment for the data in this specific row was performed.

The allocated budget for the specific 'ProjectNameEN'. WARNING: Because a project appears in multiple rows, summing this column directly will produce an incorrect, inflated number. To calculate total project budgets, you must first get a DISTINCT list of projects and their budgets, and then sum the result.
The remaining budget for the specific 'ProjectNameEN'. This value is also repeated across multiple rows for the same project.
A specific milestone associated with the project for this row.
A specific milestone associated with the project for this row in Arabic.
A specific risk identified for the project for this row.
A specific risk identified for the project for this row in Arabic.
A specific recommendation made for the project for this row.
A specific recommendation made for the project for this row in Arabic.
